messages.original: Aerial target detected, flying to Pivdenne/Dobroslav, Odesa Oblast.
2 missiles
Flying past Pivdenne to Dobroslav
Explosions in Dobroslav, Odesa Oblast

So far today, 6 Iskander-M ballistic missiles have been used against Odesa Oblast. 
4 have targeted the Dobroslav area.
2 have targeted the Mayaky Bridge.
This is in addition to numerous Geran-2 drone strikes.
Trump is expected to issue his statement shortly.
Trump has begun speaking now.
Trump has begun speaking now.
Nothing interesting. The speech is unrelated to Venezuela.

Deep State on the dire situation of Gulyaypole:
The Ukrainian military resource Deep State reports on the risk of losing Gulyaypole due to management problems and internal sabotage in the 102nd Territorial Defense Brigade. According to DS, some officers are persuading fighters to abandon their positions without authorization, while the units are not aware of the current situation of their neighbors, which leads to disorientation and additional losses.

üá∫üá¶
 Deep State on the dire situation of Gulyaypole:  The Ukrainian military resource Deep State reports on the risk of losing Gulyaypole due to management problems and internal sabotage in the 102nd Territorial Defense Brigade. According to DS, some officers‚Ä¶

The 102nd brigade has mostly been withdrawn to the rear now due to heavy losses from the encirclements east of Hulyaipole, lack of coordination, constant Russian bombardment, and low-quality fortifications. 
The issues in this unit have been known for some time, and the casualties they suffered prior to the Russian entry into Hulyaipole had meant they couldn't perform properly. This is the main reason why defences are collapsing there right now. The higher command is blame.
Deepstate published satellite imagery showing the ruins of eastern Siversk. Around 300-400 civilians remained in the city for the nearly 4 years of fighting.
4 have targeted the Dobroslav area.

2 of the Iskanders which I previously thought targeted Dobroslav, Odesa Oblast, actually hit port infrastructure near Pivdenne.
At least 7 civilians were killed and 15 others injured.

The U.S. is currently carrying out a massive series of attacks on ISIS targets in eastern and central Syria.
Fighter jets, attack helicopters, artillery, HIMARS, and ATACMS ballistic missiles are being used, striking dozens of targets, including weapons depots and operational support buildings used by militants.
The operation, dubbed "Operation Hawkeye strike" is in response to the ISIS attack that killed 3 U.S. soldiers in Palmyra, central Syria on July 13.

What will the mental gymnastics be this time?

It seems that Russia‚Äôs next large-scale, combined missile attack on Ukraine has been delayed, as no significant strategic bomber movement has been recorded for the last two days.
In my opinion, this is due to the prioritisation of smaller, more targeted attacks on Odesa Oblast with Geran-2 drones, Grom-E1 rocket glide-bombs, and Iskander-M ballistic missiles. 
Additionally, the preparation of a number of Tu-22m3 strategic bombers is underway. Two of them, each equipped with 2 Kh-32 cruise missiles, redeployed from Belaya Airbase, Irkutsk Oblast, to Engels-2 Airbase, Saratov Oblast. 2 other Tu-22m3 bombers stationed at Engels-2 Airbase are also equipped with 1 Kh-32 missile each. 
It‚Äôs also likely that two Buyan-M corvettes were equipped with Kalibr cruise missiles at Kaspiysk Naval Base, Republic of Dagestan, in the Caspian Sea. They can launch a maximum of 16 Kalibrs. 
However, 2 days ago, 1 Tu-160 and 1 Tu-95MS strategic bomber redeployed from Engels-2 Airbase to Ukrainka Airbase, Amur Oblast. There, they will likely be equipped with Kh-101 cruise missiles.
Remember, another 4 Tu-95MS are already equipped with missiles at Olenya Airbase, Murmansk Oblast, ready for use. 
As for Iskanders, deliveries of Iskander-M ballistic missiles and possibly Iskander-K cruise missiles were carried out to OTRK installations in Voronezh and Rostov Oblast.
Mass accumulation of Geran-2 and Gerbera drones continues at all major launch sites surrounding Ukraine.

Russian forces have launched a new incursion across the international border into Sumy Oblast, quickly capturing the villages of Hrabovske and Vysoke. Attacks are now underway, with the Russians attempting to penetrate deeper into the region.
As usual with these sorts of incursions, the goal is not to take large swaths of territory. The goal is to stretch Ukrainian forces even thinner, worsening the issues coming from their manpower shortages.
If Ukraine decides to redeploy units away from one direction to this new area in order to reinforce the lines, halt, and possibly even push back Russian forces, the area which they are redeployed from will be significantly weakened, making it easier for the Russians to make progress in.
This is all part of what I like to call Russia's "Whack-a-mole" tactic, which softens up the lines, and exploits the successful attrition being dealt to Ukraine right now. It puts Ukraine in a difficult spot, as if they choose not to redeploy here, the incursion zone could continue to expand and become even more difficult and costly to deal with later on. 
Essentially, they are trying to put out more fires than they can possibly deal with - and Russia keeps setting new ones. The main reason why they can't deal with all of the fires at once is because of manpower shortages, which are only continuing to get worse.
Expect more maneuvers like this in different places from Russian forces in the future.

Russian forces have captured the village of Hrabovske, Krasnopillya Direction, Sumy Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~724.
Total land area: ~3.12 km¬≤.
The fighting for Hrabovske lasted <1 day.

Russian forces have captured the village Vysoke, Krasnopillya direction, Sumy Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~28.
Total land area: ~0.37 km¬≤

In the Bilyi Kolodyaz direction, Russian forces continued to advance and have captured new positions in three different areas.
In the northeast, Russian forces continued advancing beyond Vovchansk, establishing a buffer-zone around the city where they captured positions in six different treelines to the southeast. They also continued advancing in Vovchanski-Khutory, where they established control over the rest of the eastern part of the village, including the industrial zone.
In the southwest, Russian forces continued their assault operations in Vilcha. They managed to reach the southeastern edge of the town and secured the rest of its western streets. Fighting is ongoing for the last Ukrainian positions in the southern streets.
+ ~6.80 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Velykyi Burluk direction, Russian forces continued their assault operations and are making incremental progress in two main areas.
In the northeast, Russian forces advanced south from the village of Dvorichanske to the nearby forest plantations, establishing control over them after heavy fighting, further shrinking the Ukrainian salient. Ukrainian forces are responding by heavily striking Russian temporary deployment points in Dvorichanske. The Russians also resumed attacks from the east, securing two forest plantations northwest of Kamyanka and pressuring the eastern part of the Ukrainian salient. 
In the southwest, Russian forces have been carrying out assault operations towards Putnykove for the last few weeks. So far, despite the length of the battles, they have not achieved significant success, only securing a section of the highway and adjacent treeline positions. Additionally, more recently, attacks were carried out in the direction of the Dovhenke tract. As a result, they were able to capture two treelines and reach the eastern edge of the forested areas there.
+ ~3.03 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

U.S. ‚ÄòScorpion Strike‚Äô Unit Launched Its First ‚ÄòShahed‚Äô Drone (Video)
The United States Navy has test-launched a Low-Cost Uncrewed Combat Attack System (LUCAS) long-range suicide drone from the Independence class Littoral Combat Ship (LCS) USS Santa Barbara in the Middle East.
The test, which took place on December 16, two weeks after the United States Central Command (CENTCOM) announced that it had established Task Force Scorpion Strike (TFSS) in the region, armed with the LUCAS drones.
Personnel from U.S. Naval Forces Central Command‚Äôs (NAVCENT) Task Force 59 conducted the rocket-assisted launch of the LUCAS drone from the stern flight deck of the USS Santa Barbara, according to a statement released by CENTCOM two days after the test.

Russian Army Opens New Front In Sumy, Gains High Ground After Storming Two Towns (Videos)
On December 20, the Russian military launched a surprise attack in Ukraine‚Äôs Sumy, crossing the border in a new area some 45 kilometers to the southeast of the region‚Äôs capital.
The attack, which is being led by the Sever [East] Group of Forces, appears to be a part of wider efforts by the Russian military to establish a security zone along the border with Ukraine. These efforts gained momentum following the failed Ukrainian attack on Russia‚Äôs Kursk, which borders Sumy, last year.
The 34th Separate Guards Mountain Motor Rifle Brigade began the new attack by breaking through Ukrainian defenses in Vysoke, one of the highest points along the border, then capturing the settlement. This was officially confirmed by the Russian Ministry of Defense.

Ukraine Is Close To Two Defeats In Myrnohrad And Huliaipole (Videos)
On December 20, the Russian military secured a settlement close to the city of Myrnohrad in Donetsk, squeezing the remaining Ukrainian pockets of resistance there, all while securing a new part of the city of Huliaipole in Zaporozhye.
The Tsentr [Center] Group of Forces captured Svetloye, which is located right to the northwest of Myrnohrad. The capture of the settlement caused more pressure on Ukrainian troops besieged in the northern part of the city.
Meanwhile in Huliaipole, the Vostok [East] Group of Forces continue to expand its control in the city amid a collapse in Ukrainian defenses.
